page.title: 20CHILDREN'S GAMES IN HAILSHAM
page.content: {BRITISH BULLDOG.} John is "It" and stands in the middle of the playground. The rest stand at one end, chanting his name. He chooses one of them who must run across without being caught. To catch him, John lifts him into the air chanting,{"British {Bulldog, 1, 2, 3."}He then becomes "It" as well. If the runner is not caught, the whole group run across together. This continues until eveyone is caught. {PRISONS.}Up to three people are "It". They must catch the others and put them in a circle in the middle of the playground. They can be freed by someone touching them. {POM.}One person is "It". He faces a post and counts to 100,while the rest hide.He then turns round.If he sees someone he says{"Pom 1,2,3,"}and the person's name. He is then out.
